identificationModule.briefTitle: Mood Alterations in the Patients With Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer Treated With BCG
identificationModule.officialTitle: Mood Alterations in the Patients With Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer Treated With Bacillus Calmete-Guerin

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate mood changes in patients with Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer who are receiving intravesical Bacillus Calmete-Guerin (BCG). Patients with Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer receiving intravesical treatments are eligible to participate in this study. Participation involves providing research blood and urine samples prior to the start of treatment and throughout the treatment course. The study team will also collect participant's medical history and clinical information. Participants will be asked to complete questionnaires and daily mood diaries.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Patients with Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer who are receiving intravesical treatments are eligible to participate in this study. Participants will be asked to complete the Zung Self-Rating Anxiety Scale and Zung Self-Rating Depression Scale prior to each induction intravesical treatment. During the 6-week induction intravesical treatment, participants will also be given a daily mood dairy to complete. Urine Specimens will be collected prior to each induction intravesical treatment and at each 3-month cystoscopy appointment during the treatment course. An at home urine collection may occur 6 hours post intravesical treatment. Research Blood Samples will be collected prior to the first induction intravesical treatment, prior to the fourth intravesical treatment, and prior to each 3-month follow-up cystoscopy as indicated by the participant's treatment course. Participants will be asked to complete the Zung Self-Rating Anxiety Scale and Zung Self-Rating Depression Scale prior to each 3-month follow-up cystoscopy during the treatment course. A 3-week daily mood diary will be completed by participants during the 3-week intravesical maintenance treatment. Participants will be given a daily mood diary to complete between the 3-month follow-up cystoscopy appointments.

bioSpec.description: Participants will be asked for research blood and urine samples prior to the start of treatment and throughout the treatment course. The study team will also ask participants permission to utilize excess tissue from standard of care procedures.

armGroups.label: Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer - Bacillus Calmete-Guerin (BCG) intravesical treatments
armGroups.description: Participants who are receiving BCG intravesical treatments will be asked to provide research urine samples and blood samples prior to and during their treatment course. Participants will also be asked to complete the Zung Self-Rating Anxiety Scale and Zung Self-Rating Depression Scale at the start and throughout the treatment course. Participants will be given a daily mood diary to complete at the following timepoints: 6-week induction treatment, 3-week maintenance treatment, and the 3-month follow-up. The study team will ask permission from participants to utilize excess tissue samples from standard of care procedures and biopsies. Participants' medical history and clinical data will also be collected for the study.
interventionNames: Other: Utilize excess tissue from a standard of care procedure

armGroups.label: Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer - Chemotherapy intravesical treatments
armGroups.description: Participants who are receiving chemotherapy intravesical treatments will be asked to provide research urine samples and blood samples prior to and during their treatment course. Participants will also be asked to complete the Zung Self-Rating Anxiety Scale and Zung Self-Rating Depression Scale at the start and throughout the treatment course. Participants will be given a daily mood diary to complete at the following timepoints: 6-week induction treatment, 3-week maintenance treatment, and the 3-month follow-up. The study team will ask permission from participants to utilize excess tissue samples from standard of care procedures and biopsies. Participants' medical history and clinical data will also be collected for the study.
interventionNames: Other: Utilize excess tissue from a standard of care procedure

Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer - Chemotherapy intravesical treatments

armGroupLabels: Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer - Bacillus Calmete-Guerin (BCG) intravesical treatments
Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer - Chemotherapy intravesical treatments

interventions.name: Urine Specimen Collection
interventions.description: Urine collections from patients will occur prior to each induction intravesical treatment and at 3-month follow-up cystoscopy appointments. An at home urine collection may occur 6 hours post intravesical treatment.
armGroupLabels: Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer - Bacillus Calmete-Guerin (BCG) intravesical treatments
Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer - Chemotherapy intravesical treatments

interventions.description: Blood collections will occur prior to first intravesical treatment, prior to fourth intravesical treatment, and each 3-month cystoscopy as indicated by the participant's treatment course.
armGroupLabels: Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer - Bacillus Calmete-Guerin (BCG) intravesical treatments
Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer - Chemotherapy intravesical treatments

interventions.description: Participants may indicate permission to provide excess tissue from a clinically indicated procedure for research purposes.
armGroupLabels: Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer - Bacillus Calmete-Guerin (BCG) intravesical treatments
Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer - Chemotherapy intravesical treatments

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in cytokine response as assessed by urine samples
primaryOutcomes.description: Collect urine samples from the patients with non-muscle invasive bladder cancer who are undergoing intravesical instillations for cytokine response to treatment
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Prior to each 6-week intravesical treatment and every 3-month Cystoscopy for 24 months

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in cytokine response as assessed by blood samples
primaryOutcomes.description: Collect blood samples from the patients with non-muscle invasive bladder cancer who are undergoing intravesical instillations for cytokine response to treatment
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Prior to the first intravesical treatment, prior to the fourth intravesical treatment, and prior to the each 3-month follow-up cystoscopy

primaryOutcomes.measure: Screening for Mood Disorders utilizing the Zung Self Rating Depression Scale
primaryOutcomes.description: Screen for mood disorders in patients diagnosed with Non-muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer at baseline and while undergoing treatment utilizing the Zung Self Rating Depression Scale. The Zung Self-Rating Depression Scale has the following score ranges: Normal Range (25-49), Mildly Depressed (50-59), Moderately Depressed (60-69), Severely Depressed (70 and above)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Prior to each induction intravesical treatment for six weeks and each 3-month surveillance visit

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Screening for Mood Disorders utilizing the Zung Self Rating Anxiety Scale
secondaryOutcomes.description: Screen for mood disorders in patients diagnosed with Non-muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer at baseline and while undergoing treatment utilizing the Zung Self Rating Anxiety Scale
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Prior to each induction intravesical treatment for six weeks and each 3-month surveillance visit

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Screening for Mood Disorders utilizing daily mood diaries
secondaryOutcomes.description: Screening for Mood Disorders at baseline and through the treatment course with daily mood diaries
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Daily mood diary for 6-week induction intravesical treatment course, daily mood diary for 3-week intravesical treatment maintenance course, and daily mood diary between 3-month follow up cystoscopy appointments

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Evaluate DNA and RNA-based liquid biopsy biomarkers and correlate them with tissue response
secondaryOutcomes.description: Collect blood and urine samples from the patients with non-muscle invasive bladder cancer who are undergoing intravesical instillations and compare them with excess tissue from a clinically indicated procedure
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Prior to the first intravesical treatment, prior to the fourth intravesical treatment, and prior to each 3-month follow-up cystoscopy

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Subjects with a pathologically confirmed non-muscle invasive bladder cancer
* Age ≥ 18 years old
* Ability to understand and willingness to sign a written informed consent document

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients that are not candidates for intravesical treatment due to the nature of their disease, such as variant histology or progressive disease after a prior course of intravesical treatment.
* Patients who are pregnant
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Subjects that are 18 years old or older who have pathologically confirmed non-muscle invasive bladder cancer. Subjects receiving intravesical treatments as part of their standard of care.
